suncertify.business

Interface SubcontractorService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RemoteSubcontractorService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSubcontractorService, RMIRemoteSubcontractorService

    public interface SubcontractorService
    The SubcontractorService interface contains all business functionality of the application. This interface has two implementations, one for client mode and the other for standalone mode. The instantiation of either is done at runtime based on whichever mode the application is started with. The presentation layer accesses the business layer through this interface, regardless of the implementation i.e. It doesn't know whether the subcontractor records are being presented locally or remotely. The functionality in this interface is similar to that of DBMain but contains more abstraction and deals directly with Subcontractor Object DTOs rather than string arrays
    Author:
    Kieran O'Brien

    • Method Detail

      • getAllSubcontractors

        java.util.List<SubcontractorRecord> getAllSubcontractors()
                                                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns all subcontractor records from the database or an empty list if none are found
        Returns:
        A List of subcontractor record objects
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        SubcontractorNotFoundException

      • getSubcontractor

        SubcontractorRecord getSubcontractor(int subcontractorRecordNumber)
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                            SubcontractorNotFoundException
        Given the specified record number this method finds and returns the subcontractor record object if it exists. If the record does not exist in the database an exception is raised. All data regarding this subcontractor record is accessible via the subcontractor object.
        Parameters:
        subcontractorRecordNumber - The record number of the subcontractor
        Returns:
        The subcontractor record
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        SubcontractorNotFoundException

      • bookSubcontractor

        void bookSubcontractor(int subcontractorRecordNumber,
                     java.lang.String ownerID)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              SubcontractorNotFoundException,
                              SubcontractorAlreadyBookedException
        Books a subcontractor record for the specified customer ID. If the record is already booked a SubcontractorAlreadyBookedException is thrown
        Parameters:
        subcontractorRecordNumber - The subcontractor record number
        ownerID - The customer ID to book the record with
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        SubcontractorNotFoundException
        SubcontractorAlreadyBookedException

      • findSubcontractorsByNameAndLocation

        java.util.List<SubcontractorRecord> findSubcontractorsByNameAndLocation(java.lang.String name,
                                                                      java.lang.String location)
                                                                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                                               SubcontractorNotFoundException
        Finds and returns all subcontractor records that have a name and location that matches exactly the specified arguments. DESIGN DECISION: I have excluded other subcontractor fields from being searchable as only the name and location are a business requirement at this moment. If it is a requirement in the future to search for other fields extra methods can easily be added to this interface.
        Parameters:
        name - The subcontractor's name
        location - The subcontractor's location
        Returns:
        A List of subcontractor record objects
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        SubcontractorNotFoundException

      • saveData

        void saveData()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                     ServicesException
        Saves all subcontractor records that are in memory back to the database file. This method is called when the application terminates.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        ServicesException
